title: Livestream: Day 5 of the Brian Walshe murder trial
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime A State Police digital cellphone forensic specialist will return to the stand for cross-examination.
Livestream via NBC10 Boston.

On Thursday afternoon, a Massachusetts State Police digital forensic expert, Connor Keefe, revealed in Norfolk Superior Court what investigators say they uncovered from two cellphones linked to Brian Walshe.

title: Red Sox reportedly have ‘big interest’ in signing Japanese infielder
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox are reportedly one of the teams who have expressed a “big interest” in Okamoto — alongside the Blue Jays and Pirates.
Kazuma Okamoto had six seasons of 30-plus homers in Japan.

(AP Photo/Hiro Komae, File) By Conor Ryan December 5, 2025 | 7:39 AM 1 minute to read One of the top priorities this offseason for Craig Breslow and the Red Sox’ front office is adding more pop to the lineup — preferably at an infield position.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Quizzes Ticketmaster trauma, some tax and train troubles, and a cranberry conundrum are all part of this week’s news quiz.
Olivia Dean is coming to TD Garden in 2026 .
OR IS SHE?

title: Finally granted a shot in NHL, Alex Steeves is looking like an impact player for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "Call-ups are fighting tooth and nail, and I feel like I've been fighting tooth and nail for four years to be here.
" Alex Steeves posted two first-period points on Thursday.

title: Hamilton town official severely injured, horse killed after biker allegedly spooked them on Ipswich trail
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Two weeks after the accident left her hospitalized, the injured rider is speaking out to educate others on equestrian safety.
Photos of Rosie Kennedy with her 8-year-old horse, Pops before the Nov.
21 accident.

title: Red Sox trade for Pirates pitcher Johan Oviedo in 5-player deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox Oviedo's swing-and-miss stuff on the mound could make him an intriguing pickup.
Johan Oviedo is an intriguing addition to Boston's rotation.
AP Photo/Colin Hubbard A week after Boston acquired starting pitcher Sonny Gray in a deal with the Cardinals, Craig Breslow and the Red Sox were at it again on Thursday.

title: Michelin-recommended Back Bay restaurant sued by staff over tips
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Plaintiffs say at least $51,000 worth of tips were withheld from staff at La Padrona, a Back Bay Italian spot that received a Michelin recommendation last month.
La Padrona in Raffles Boston.
Pat Greenhouse/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Former Mass. high school wrestling coach convicted of attempting to send obscene material to minor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The former Burlington High School coach was found guilty Wednesday after he was arrested and indicted last year.
A former Burlington High School wrestling coach has been convicted for sending sexually explicit messages and photos to an undercover agent posing as a minor, according to prosecutors.
Stephen Lemelin, 51, of Burlington, was found guilty Wednesday on three counts of attempted transfer of obscene material to a minor, the U.

title: 2 mpox cases confirmed in Worcester as Mass. health officials warn of ‘concerning’ uptick
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News As of Dec.
1, there have been 51 confirmed mpox cases in Massachusetts this year, with 37 of those cases occurring between Aug.
1 and Dec.

title: Watertown officials warn about rogue raccoon that rushed resident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The town’s animal control officials are asking residents to keep their eyes peeled for the tailed transgressor.
The raccoon pictured here in 2023 has a clean record as far as Watertown police are concerned.
